intro: Conostylis canescens, commonly known as the silver everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves and produces small, fluffy seed heads that give it a distinctive appearance. It is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Conostylis canescens is an important plant in native ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
